issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: After the changes in HADOOP-8014 went in, MR programs using viewfs broke. This is because, viewfs now expects getDefaultBlockSize, getDefaultReplication, and getServerDefaults to pass in a {{path}} as an argument. In the existing MR source, these are called with no arguments.

comments.body:
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.MRAppMaster: Error starting MRAppMaster
org.apache.hadoop.fs.viewfs.NotInMountpointException: getDefaultBlockSize on
empty path is invalid
        at
org.apache.hadoop.fs.viewfs.ViewFileSystem.getDefaultBlockSize(ViewFileSystem.java:477)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.job.impl.JobImpl.makeUberDecision(JobImpl.java:826)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.job.impl.JobImpl.access$2600(JobImpl.java:113)
        at

        at
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.job.impl.JobImpl$InitTransition.transition(JobImpl.java:933)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.yarn.state.StateMachineFactory$MultipleInternalArc.doTransition(StateMachineFactory.java:380)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.yarn.state.StateMachineFactory.doTransition(StateMachineFactory.java:298)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.yarn.state.StateMachineFactory.access$300(StateMachineFactory.java:43)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.yarn.state.StateMachineFactory$InternalStateMachine.doTransition(StateMachineFactory.java:443)
        at

        at
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.job.impl.JobImpl.handle(JobImpl.java:112)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.MRAppMaster$JobEventDispatcher.handle(MRAppMaster.java:865)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.MRAppMaster.start(MRAppMaster.java:815)
        at
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.MRAppMaster$1.run(MRAppMaster.java:1031)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at javax.security.auth.Subject.doAs(Subject.java:396)
Attaching a patch with no test so that Jenkins can run, while I will investigate adding a test.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12522254/MR-4133.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    -1 javac.  The patch appears to cause tar ant target to fail.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to cause Findbugs (version 1.3.9) to fail.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed the unit tests build

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2200//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2200//console

This message is automatically generated.

I do not know why the build failed. It seems odd because I can get it to compile fine on my trunk view. 

Also, I am finding it difficult to write test for this, especially since this should have been part of HADOOP-8014 change and that has separate viewfs tests associated with it.
Attaching the same patch again to kick Jenkins

The code changes look good to me.  I am curious about your own testing of this.  Have you run an MR job from start to finish on viewfs?
Yes, I just ran an MR job with (test passes) and without (test fails) the change configuring viewfs as the defaultFS.
+1 I will check this in shortly.

Thanks for the patch John,

I put this into trunk, branch-2, and branch-0.23
